title: Michael Corcoran (musician)
text:
Michael Corcoran (born December 9, 1972), known professionally as Backhouse Mike or Ken Lofkoll, is an American record producer, composer, and musician. He has composed songs for "<a href="Drake%20%26amp%3B%20Josh">Drake & Josh</a>", "<a href="iCarly">iCarly</a>", "<a href="Victorious">Victorious</a>", "<a href="Shake%20It%20Up%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">Shake It Up</a>", "<a href="Hit%20the%20Floor%20%28TV%20series%29">Hit the Floor</a>", "<a href="Sam%20%26amp%3B%20Cat">Sam & Cat</a>", "<a href="Liv%20and%20Maddie">Liv and Maddie</a>", "<a href="Henry%20Danger">Henry Danger</a>", and "<a href="The%20Mr.%20Peabody%20%26amp%3B%20Sherman%20Show">The Mr. Peabody & Sherman Show</a>".
Career.
From around 2003 to early 2010 he was a member of <a href="Drake%20Bell">Drake Bell</a>'s band. His band "Backhouse Mike", which consisted of lead singer and guitarist Jon Seminara, bassist John Charles Meyer, and keyboardist Kimberly Barnett) appeared in the "<a href="iCarly">iCarly</a>" episode "iAm Your Biggest Fan" and the final episode of "<a href="Zoey%20101">Zoey 101</a>", "," using the name "Backflesh". The band's song "Take Me Back" appears on the <a href="iCarly%20%28soundtrack%29">"iCarly" soundtrack</a>.
Personal life.
On August 8, 2020, Corcoran married actress <a href="Elizabeth%20Gillies">Elizabeth Gillies</a> at a private ceremony in New Jersey after the pair began dating in late 2012.
